page.title: 14HOME LIFE contd.
page.content: focus for this. The Church has gained from the new arrivals, and it seems assured a future - many people become involved in church money raising functions, because they believe that the church needs to be maintained, even if they are not worshippers. All in all, the parish seems to have accepted the inevitable. It is no longer a parish of farmers and farm labourers, but a mixture and those who earn their livings in the nearby towns of Kiddeminster and Droitwich. The farm land remains in the hands of local farmers, although often the farmhouses and barns are the homes of 'newcomers'. As a parish, it has seen a number of changes in the last 20 years - it shares it's vicar with three other parishes for example - but it will no doubt survive.
